SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) is the most common malignancy diagnosed in children
Extramedullary leukemia including hepatosplenomegaly, lymphadenopathy, and mediastinal mass are the clinical presentations of T-cell ALL
Pericardial effusion and atrial mass are rare presentations of pediatric leukemia
CASE PRESENTATION: We report a 15-year-old girl with T-cell ALL, who presented initially with pericardial effusion and cardiac tamponade and subsequently developed right atrial mass
The mediastinal and right atrial masses were excised by surgical procedure as a treatment strategy for prevention of arrhythmia and sudden death
CONCLUSION: T-cell ALL can present with pericardial and mediastinal involvement as an initial manifestation
Pericardiocenthesis and systemic anticancer chemotherapy without local chemotherapy should be considered in these cases
